I am not against modernizing art. But, when the need for talent to make the art is taken out, I do not consider it art. If Da Vinci had Photoshop to make the Mona Lisa, would that still be art? Would that still be worth as much as it is? No, because he used a computer program to assist him. And I do not discriminate against strictly Electronic music. I find Pop to also have lost its art form due to electronic beats and autotune, and to a lesser extent hip-hop is becoming that way.

I do not treat techno as music because I do not treat a computer program as an instrument. That is why everything on my Ipod is live performances, its all unedited bycomputers

It takes skill to play instruments but it takes more skill to actually make good music. You can learn how to play a saxophone in a couple of years but to learn how to pick up a saxophone and make beautiful music, not just play it, takes a lot longer. Techno just skips a step you still don't just start up the program and press a big golden make music button. I guess what I am trying to say is that I don't respect your opinion.

With all do respect, I don't treat dubstep as music. Or most forms of Techno. The only Electronic music that I deem music is stuff like Pendulum. They are electronic yes, but it takes talent to play their songs. Actual instrumental talents. I do not consider Computer programs to be instruments. Sorry.

With all due respect, I believe that you don't know what you are talking about. Producing electronic music is sort of a different thing altogether from making other types of music. Sure, most EDM producers can't actually create the music live, but it does take weeks, even months, of creativity and mastering to create a track, not to mention learning how to use turntables to live mix all of the tracks together live seamlessly. It only looks effortless to someone who doesn't know how it works.

No. Have you ever tried to make any kind of actual music, rock, metal, or  hell even country?
